Job__06.2: O that <u>my sins</u>, whereby I have deserved wrath, and the calamity that I suffer, were weighed in a balance.
Job__06.3: As the sand of the sea this would appear heavier: therefore my words are full of sorrow:
Job__06.4: For the arrows of the Lord are in me, the rage whereof drinketh up my spirit, and the terrors of the Lord war against me.
Job__06.5: Will the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or will the ox low when he standeth before a full manger?
Job__06.6: Or can an unsavoury thing be eaten, that is not seasoned with salt? or can a man taste that which when tasted bringeth death?
Job__06.7: The things which before my soul would not touch, now, through anguish are my meats.
Job__06.8: Who will grant that my request may come: and that God may give me what I look for?
Job__06.9: And that he that hath begun may destroy me, that he may let loose his hand, and cut me off?
Job__06.10: And that this may be my comfort, that afflicting me with sorrow, he spare not, nor I contradict the words of the Holy One.
Job__06.11: For what is my strength, that I can hold out? or what is my end that I should keep patience?
Job__06.12: My strength is not the strength of stones, nor is my flesh of brass.
Job__06.13: Behold there is no help for me in myself, and my familiar friends also are departed from me.
Job__06.14: He that taketh away mercy from his friend, forsaketh the fear of the Lord.
Job__06.15: My brethren have passed by me, as the torrent that passeth swiftly in the valleys.
Job__06.16: They that fear the hoary frost, the snow shall fall upon them.
Job__06.17: At the time when they shall be scattered they shall perish: and after it groweth hot they shall be melted out of their place.
Job__06.18: The paths of their steps are entangled: they shall walk in vain, and shall perish.
Job__06.19: Consider the paths of Thema, the ways of Saba, and wait a little while.
Job__06.20: They are confounded, because I have hoped: they are come also even unto me, and are covered with shame.
Job__06.21: Now you are come: and now seeing my affliction you are afraid.
Job__06.22: Did I say: Bring to me, and give me of your substance?
Job__06.23: Or deliver me from the hand of the enemy, and rescue me out of the hand of the mighty?
Job__06.24: Teach me, and I will hold my peace: and if I have been ignorant in any thing, instruct me.
Job__06.25: Why have you detracted the words of truth, whereas there is none of you that can reprove me?
Job__06.26: You dress up speeches only to rebuke, and you utter words to the wind.
Job__06.27: You rush in upon the fatherless, and you endeavour to overthrow your friend.
Job__06.28: However finish what you have begun, give ear, and see whether I lie.
Job__06.29: Answer, I beseech you, without contention: and speaking that which is just, judge ye.
Job__06.30: And you shall not And iniquity in my tongue, neither shall folly sound in my mouth.
